gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class Concept

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.Concept
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Ontology

    public class Concept
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ontology
    A basic implementation of an abstract, ontological concept without textual grounding. A concept consists of a name, a set of semantic types and a source. Instances of Entity (which are textually grounded) can be associated with multiple concepts.

    This class also can maintain a static concept hierarchy (provided such a hierarchy exists), which can be loaded from a file. The concept hierarchy structure is quite rudimentary at the moment: each hierarchical relation is encoded as a string of the form [conceptId1]|[conceptId2], where conceptId1 is a descendant of conceptId2.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • loadHierarchy

        public static void loadHierarchy(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads the hierarchical relations between concepts from a file. We currently assume each line consists of simple concatenation of two concept ids. [ID1][ID2], indicating that ID1 is a descendant of ID2.
        Parameters:
        filename - the file containing the hierarchical relations
